report_title: Big Hat Group Weekly Security Update Report
report_description: The Weekly Security Update Report is provided by Big Hat Group with the goal of making it easier to find the information System Administrators and Security Professionals need to keep their systems secure. The CVE Weekly Report is provided as a beta resource.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21336 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a low severity spoofing vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21336. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cover and spoof elements of the UI, with the modified information being only visual. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability requires user interaction, where the victim needs to open the vulnerable app. The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to take additional actions prior to exploitation to prepare the target environment. Microsoft has provided a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 121.0.2277.83, addressing this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply this security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
